title: librustc_driver cannot find codegen-backends dir if if $bindir != $prefix/bin
body:
In a "traditional" environment, rustc is located in `/usr/bin/rustc`, thus `filesearch::get_or_default_sysroot()` returns `/usr`, which is usually also the `prefix`.
`filesearch::relative_target_lib_path` uses the value passed to `--libdir` if any, usually `lib`, thus returning something like `lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib`
`get_trans_sysroot` then combines the two which gives us `/usr/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib`

Now, The case when it doesn't work:
On exherbo, prefix is `/usr`, bindir is `/usr/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/bin`, libdir is `/usr/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/lib`.
First, I had to change the libdir to be relative to prefix, otherwise bootstrap was trying to unlink stuff from the system when building in `builder::sysroot_libdir`.
So now libdir is `x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/lib`.
rustc is located in `/usr/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/bin/rustc`, thus `filesearch::get_or_default_sysroot()` returns `/usr/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu`.
`filesearch::relative_target_lib_path` returns `x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/lib`
`get_trans_sysroot` then combines the two which gives us `/usr/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib` which doesn't exist.

`--libdir` is defined as relative to `--prefix` but is used by librustc_driver as relative to the parent directory of `bindir`, which failes when it's not equal to `--prefix`.

Whilst we may not want to change the current behaviour, I think it's a good idea to look into prefix to.
Currently we do `let mut sysroot_candidates = vec![filesearch::get_or_default_sysroot()];`

Would a patch changing it to something like `let mut sysroot_candidates = vec![filesearch::get_or_default_sysroot(), env!("CFG_PREFIX")];` be accepted?
